alert.note: Alert for Albany; Carbon (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 15 at 9:10PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM MDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of the Mullen Burn Scar, including the following counties, in south central Wyoming, Carbon. In southeast Wyoming, Albany. * WHEN...Until 1215 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 910 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Albany, Miller Lake Campground, Evans Creek Campground, Bobbie Thompson Campground, Illinois Creek Campground, Lake Owen, Lake Owen Campground, Woods Landing-Jelm and Woods Landing. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas.
